questions.question: Which of the following components of the AWS Global Infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers interconnected through low latency links?
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone is made up of one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, all linked by low-latency connections. Regions are geographical areas that contain multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: One benefit of On-Demand Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) pricing is:

options.text: The ability to bid for a lower hourly cost.
Paying a daily rate regardless of time used.
Pre-paying for instances and paying a lower hourly rate.

questions.explanation: On-Demand EC2 pricing lets customers pay only for the compute time they actually use, with no long-term commitment or upfront payment. This provides flexibility and cost control.

questions.question: What can assist in evaluating an application for migration to the cloud? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Professional Services and AWS Partner Network (APN) help organizations assess, plan, and execute cloud migrations. Trusted Advisor and Systems Manager are operational tools, not migration-assessment services.

questions.question: A characteristic of edge locations is that they:

options.text: Host Amazon EC2 instances closer to users.
Help lower latency and improve performance for users.
Cache frequently changing data without reaching the origin server.

questions.explanation: Edge locations are designed to reduce latency and improve performance by caching and delivering content closer to end users.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid ways for a customer to interact with AWS services? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Customers can interact with AWS using the Command Line Interface (CLI) and Software Development Kits (SDKs), which allow programmatic access to AWS services.

questions.question: What is a value proposition of the AWS Cloud?

options.text: AWS is responsible for security in the AWS Cloud.
AWS manages user applications in the AWS Cloud.

questions.explanation: One of AWS’s main value propositions is that customers do not need long-term contracts. They can scale resources up or down and pay only for what they use.

questions.question: A company is migrating an application that is running non-interruptible workloads for a three-year time frame. Which pricing construct would provide the MOST cost-effective solution?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide the best cost savings for workloads that run continuously over a long period, such as three years of non-interruptible workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to track record, and audit configuration changes made to AWS resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Config tracks, records, and audits configuration changes to AWS resources, allowing customers to review how their infrastructure has changed over time.

questions.question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company’s requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
questions.explanation: AWS’s global reach allows customers to deploy resources in multiple geographic locations, enabling low latency for users around the world.

questions.question: How can one AWS account use Reserved Instances from another AWS account?

options.text: By using Amazon EC2 Dedicated Instances.
By using AWS Organizations consolidated billing.
By using the AWS Cost Explorer tool.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations with consolidated billing allows Reserved Instance discounts to be shared across multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question: What are the benefits of developing and running a new application in the AWS Cloud compared to on-premises? (Select TWO)

options.text: AWS automatically distributes the data globally for higher durability.
AWS will take care of operating the application.
AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability.
AWS can easily accommodate application demand changes.
AWS takes care of application security patching.

questions.explanation: AWS makes it easy to build highly available architectures and to scale resources up or down automatically as application demand changes.

questions.question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?
questions.explanation: With Amazon EC2, the customer is responsible for the operating system, patching, and network configuration, while AWS manages the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: AWS supports which of the following methods to add security to Identity and Access Management (IAM) users? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: IAM security is strengthened by enforcing strong passwords and using Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), which adds an extra layer of protection.

questions.question: Which service provides a hybrid storage service that enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use cloud storage?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway allows on-premises applications to use AWS cloud storage as if it were local, providing a hybrid storage solution.

questions.question: Where should a company go to search software listings from independent software vendors to find, test, buy and deploy software that runs on AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is a digital catalog where customers can find, test, buy, and deploy software from independent vendors that runs on AWS.

questions.question: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are a core part of the AWS Global Infrastructure, allowing customers to deploy resources in different geographic locations.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model adjusts based on supply and demand of EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances use unused EC2 capacity and their price changes based on supply and demand, often providing significant discounts.

questions.question: A company wants to migrate its applications to a VPC on AWS These applications will need to access on-premises resources. What combination of actions will enable the company to accomplish this goals? (Select TWO)

options.text: Use the AWS Service Catalog to identify a list of on-premises resources that can be migrated
Build a VPN connection between an on-premises device and a virtual private gateway in the new VPC
Use Amazon Athena to query data from the on-premises database servers
Connect the company’s on-premises data center to AWS using AWS Direct Connect
Leverage Amazon CloudFront to restrict access to static web content provided through the company’s on-premises web servers

questions.explanation: A VPN connection and AWS Direct Connect both provide secure network connectivity between on-premises environments and a VPC in AWS.

questions.question: A Cloud Practitioner must determine if any security groups in an AWS account have been provisioned to allow unrestricted access for specific ports. What is the SIMPLEST way to do this?

options.text: Review the inbound rules for each security group in the Amazon EC2 management console to check for port 0.0.0.0/0.
Run AWS Trusted Advisor and review the findings.
Open the AWS IAM console and check the inbound rule filters for open access.
In AWS Config, create a custom rule that invokes an AWS Lambda function to review firewall rules for inbound access.

questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor automatically checks for security risks such as overly permissive security groups, making it the simplest way to identify open ports.

questions.question: Which of the following security-related services does AWS offer? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS provides security checks through Trusted Advisor and supports data encryption to help protect data at rest and in transit.

questions.question: Which of the following services have Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) mitigation features? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront include built-in protection against DDoS attacks by filtering and absorbing malicious traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS features enables a user to launch a pre-configured Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance?
questions.explanation: An Amazon Machine Image (AMI) is a pre-configured template used to launch EC2 instances with specific operating systems and software.

questions.question: A solution that is able to support growth in users, traffic, or data size with no drop in performance aligns with which cloud architecture principle?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows a system to automatically scale resources as demand increases or decreases, maintaining performance.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud benefit eliminates the need for users to try estimating future infrastructure usage?

options.text: Easy and fast deployment of applications in multiple Regions around the world.
Lower variable costs due to massive economies of scale.

questions.explanation: Elasticity removes the need to guess future capacity because AWS resources automatically scale based on demand.

questions.question: What can users access from AWS Artifact?

options.text: A download of configuration management details for all AWS resources.
A security assessment of the applications deployed in the AWS Cloud.

questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance and security documentation such as audit reports.

questions.question: Compared with costs in traditional and virtualized data centers, AWS has:

options.text: Greater variable costs and greater upfront costs.
Fixed usage costs and lower upfront costs.
Lower variable costs and greater upfront costs.
Lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.

questions.explanation: AWS uses a pay-as-you-go model with no large upfront costs and benefits from economies of scale, resulting in lower variable and upfront costs.

questions.question: Which AWS service would a customer use with a static website to achieve tower latency and high transfer speeds?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront delivers content through edge locations, improving speed and reducing latency for users accessing static websites.

questions.question: How do Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups help achieve high availability for a web application?

options.text: They automatically add more instances across multiple AWS Regions based on global demand of the application.
They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones when the application needs it.
They enable the application’s stalk: content to reside closer to end users.
They are able to distribute incoming requests across a tier of web server instances.

questions.explanation: Auto Scaling groups distribute instances across multiple Availability Zones and replace unhealthy instances automatically, improving availability.

questions.question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.text: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.

questions.explanation: IAM policies define which users and roles can access specific S3 buckets and objects.

questions.question: How should a customer forecast the future costs for running a new web application?
questions.explanation: The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator helps estimate and forecast the cost of running workloads in AWS.

questions.question: Where are AWS compliance documents, such as an SOC 1 report, located?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is the central service for accessing compliance reports such as SOC 1.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks is the responsibility of AWS?

options.text: Configuring AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles.

questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for securing the underlying infrastructure, including the EC2 hypervisor.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model which of the following areas are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for patching their operating systems and configuring security groups under the shared responsibility model.

questions.question: A company is looking for a scalable data warehouse solution. Which of the following AWS solutions would meet the company’s needs?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, scalable data warehouse service designed for analytics workloads.

questions.question: Much AWS services provide a way to extend an on-premises architecture to the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect and AWS Storage Gateway allow companies to extend their on-premises infrastructure into AWS.

questions.question: What are the advantages of the AWS Cloud (Select TWO)

options.text: No need to guess capacity requirements.
Physical access to cloud data centers.

questions.explanation: AWS removes the need to guess capacity and allows faster deployment of resources, increasing speed to market.

questions.question: How can the AWS Cloud increase user workforce productivity after migration from an on-premises data center?

options.text: Users do not have to wait for infrastructure provisioning.
The AWS Cloud infrastructure is much faster than an on-premises data center infrastructure.
AWS takes over application configuration management on behalf of users.
Users do not need to address security and compliance issues.

questions.explanation: Because infrastructure can be provisioned in minutes, users can focus on building and deploying applications instead of waiting for hardware.

questions.question: Which of the following services could be used to deploy an application to servers running on-premises? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS OpsWorks and AWS CodeDeploy can deploy applications to on-premises servers as well as to AWS environments.

questions.question: What is an example of agility in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Using Consolidated Billing to produce one bill.
Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources.

questions.explanation: Agility means being able to get new compute resources quickly, allowing organizations to respond faster to business needs.

questions.question: Which AWS security service protects applications from distributed denial of service attacks with always-on detection and automatic inline mitigations?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield provides always-on DDoS detection and automatic mitigation to protect AWS workloads.

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing? (Choose two)

options.text: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts.
Service limits increasing by default in all accounts.
A fixed discount on the monthly bill.
Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined.
The automatic extension of the master account’s AWS support plan to all accounts.

questions.explanation: Consolidated billing provides one bill for multiple accounts and combines usage to qualify for volume discounts.

questions.question: A company is considering using AWS for a self-hosted database that requires a nightly shutdown for maintenance and cost-saving purposes. Which service should the company use?

options.text: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) with Amazon EC2 instance store.
Amazon EC2 with Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS).

questions.explanation: Using EC2 with Amazon EBS allows the instance to be stopped at night while preserving the database data on the EBS volume, saving costs.
